intro: Gnaphalium frigidum, commonly known as the alpine cudweed, is a flowering plant native to cold regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in compact clusters. The plant typically grows in alpine and arctic environments, where it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, white pubescence. Gnaphalium frigidum is known for its ability to withstand harsh climatic conditions, making it a resilient component of high-altitude ecosystems.
